org.mule.modules.hdfs

Class HDFSConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mule.modules.hdfs.HDFSConnector

  • @Connector(name="hdfs",
           schemaVersion="5.0",
           friendlyName="HDFS",
           description="HDFS Connector",
           minMuleVersion="3.6.0")
@RequiresEnterpriseLicense(allowEval=true)
@ReconnectOn(exceptions=java.io.IOException.class)
public class HDFSConnector
extends Object
    Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) Connector.
    Author:
    MuleSoft Inc.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        @Source(friendlyName="Read from path",
        sourceStrategy=POLLING,
        pollingPeriod=5000L)
public void read(String path,
               @Default(value="4096")
               int bufferSize,
               org.mule.api.callback.SourceCallback sourceCallback)
          throws HDFSConnectorException
        Read the content of a file designated by its path and streams it to the rest of the flow, while adding the path metadata in the following inbound properties:
        • HDFS_PATH_EXISTS: a boolean set to true if the path exists
        • HDFS_CONTENT_SUMMARY: an instance of ContentSummary if the path exists.
        • HDFS_FILE_STATUS: an instance of FileStatus if the path exists.
        • HDFS_FILE_CHECKSUM: an instance of FileChecksum if the path exists, is a file and has a checksum.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file to read.
        bufferSize - the buffer size to use when reading the file.
        sourceCallback - the SourceCallback used to propagate the event to the rest of the flow.
        Throws:
        HDFSConnectorException - if any issue occurs during the execution.

      • readOperation

        @Processor(friendlyName="Read from path")
public InputStream readOperation(String path,
                                  @Default(value="4096")
                                  int bufferSize)
                          throws HDFSConnectorException
        Read the content of a file designated by its path and streams it to the rest of the flow:
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file to read.
        bufferSize - the buffer size to use when reading the file.
        Returns:
        the result from executing the rest of the flow.
        Throws:
        HDFSConnectorException - if any issue occurs during the execution.

      • getMetadata

        @Processor(friendlyName="Get path meta data")
public void getMetadata(String path,
                         org.mule.api.MuleEvent muleEvent)
                 throws HDFSConnectorException
        Get the metadata of a path, as described in read(String, int, SourceCallback), and store it in flow variables.

        This flow variables are:

        • hdfs.path.exists - Indicates if the path exists (true or false)
        • hdfs.content.summary - A resume of the path info
        • hdfs.file.checksum - MD5 digest of the file (if it is a file and exists)
        • hdfs.file.status - A Hadoop object that contains info about the status of the file (org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileStatus
        Parameters:
        path - the path whose existence must be checked.
        muleEvent - the MuleEvent currently being processed.
        Throws:
        HDFSConnectorException - if any issue occurs during the execution.

      • write

        @Processor(friendlyName="Write to path")
public void write(String path,
                   @Default(value="700")
                   String permission,
                   @Default(value="true")
                   boolean overwrite,
                   @Default(value="4096")
                   int bufferSize,
                   @Default(value="1")
                   int replication,
                   @Default(value="1048576")
                   long blockSize,
                   @Optional
                   String ownerUserName,
                   @Optional
                   String ownerGroupName,
                   @Default(value="#[payload]")
                   InputStream payload)
           throws HDFSConnectorException
        Write the current payload to the designated path, either creating a new file or appending to an existing one.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file to write to.
        permission - the file system permission to use if a new file is created, either in octal or symbolic format (umask).
        overwrite - if a pre-existing file should be overwritten with the new content.
        bufferSize - the buffer size to use when appending to the file.
        replication - block replication for the file.
        blockSize - the buffer size to use when appending to the file.
        ownerUserName - the username owner of the file.
        ownerGroupName - the group owner of the file.
        payload - the payload to write to the file.
        Throws:
        HDFSConnectorException - if any issue occurs during the execution.

      • append

        @Processor(friendlyName="Append to file")
public void append(String path,
                    @Default(value="4096")
                    int bufferSize,
                    @Default(value="#[payload]")
                    InputStream payload)
            throws HDFSConnectorException
        Append the current payload to a file located at the designated path. Note: by default the Hadoop server has the append option disabled. In order to be able append any data to an existing file refer to dfs.support.append configuration parameter
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file to write to.
        bufferSize - the buffer size to use when appending to the file.
        payload - the payload to append to the file.
        Throws:
        HDFSConnectorException - if any issue occurs during the execution.

        @Processor
public void deleteFile(String path)
                throws HDFSConnectorException
        Delete the file or directory located at the designated path.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file to delete.
        Throws:
        HDFSConnectorException - if any issue occurs during the execution.

        @Processor
public void deleteDirectory(String path)
                     throws HDFSConnectorException
        Delete the file or directory located at the designated path.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the directory to delete.
        Throws:
        HDFSConnectorException - if any issue occurs during the execution.

      • makeDirectories

        @Processor
public void makeDirectories(String path,
                             @Optional
                             String permission)
                     throws HDFSConnectorException
        Make the given file and all non-existent parents into directories. Has the semantics of Unix 'mkdir -p'. Existence of the directory hierarchy is not an error.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to create directories for.
        permission - the file system permission to use when creating the directories, either in octal or symbolic format (umask).
        Throws:
        HDFSConnectorException - if any issue occurs during the execution.

      • rename

        @Processor
public Boolean rename(String source,
                       String target)
               throws HDFSConnectorException
        Renames path target to path destination.
        Parameters:
        source - the source path to be renamed.
        target - the target new path after rename.
        Returns:
        Boolean true if rename is successful.
        Throws:
        HDFSConnectorException - if any issue occurs during the execution.

      • listStatus

        @Processor
public List<org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileStatus> listStatus(String path,
                                                         @Optional
                                                         String filter)
                                                 throws HDFSConnectorException
        List the statuses of the files/directories in the given path if the path is a directory
        Parameters:
        path - the given path
        filter - the user supplied path filter
        Returns:
        FileStatus the statuses of the files/directories in the given path
        Throws:
        HDFSConnectorException - if any issue occurs during the execution.

      • globStatus

        @Processor
public List<org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileStatus> globStatus(String pathPattern,
                                                         @Optional
                                                         org.apache.hadoop.fs.PathFilter filter)
                                                 throws HDFSConnectorException
        Return all the files that match file pattern and are not checksum files. Results are sorted by their names.
        Parameters:
        pathPattern - a regular expression specifying the path pattern.
        filter - the user supplied path filter
        Returns:
        FileStatus an array of paths that match the path pattern.
        Throws:
        HDFSConnectorException - if any issue occurs during the execution.

      • copyFromLocalFile

        @Processor
public void copyFromLocalFile(@Default(value="false")
                               boolean deleteSource,
                               @Default(value="true")
                               boolean overwrite,
                               String source,
                               String target)
                       throws HDFSConnectorException
        Copy the source file on the local disk to the FileSystem at the given target path, set deleteSource if the source should be removed.
        Parameters:
        deleteSource - whether to delete the source.
        overwrite - whether to overwrite a existing file.
        source - the source path on the local disk.
        target - the target path on the File System.
        Throws:
        HDFSConnectorException - if any issue occurs during the execution.

      • copyToLocalFile

        @Processor
public void copyToLocalFile(@Default(value="false")
                             boolean deleteSource,
                             @Default(value="false")
                             boolean useRawLocalFileSystem,
                             String source,
                             String target)
                     throws HDFSConnectorException
        Copy the source file on the FileSystem to local disk at the given target path, set deleteSource if the source should be removed. useRawLocalFileSystem indicates whether to use RawLocalFileSystem as it is a non CRC File System.
        Parameters:
        deleteSource - whether to delete the source.
        useRawLocalFileSystem - whether to use RawLocalFileSystem as local file system or not.
        source - the source path on the File System.
        target - the target path on the local disk.
        Throws:
        HDFSConnectorException - if any issue occurs during the execution.

      • setPermission

        @Processor
public void setPermission(String path,
                           String permission)
                   throws HDFSConnectorException
        Set permission of a path (i.e., a file or a directory).
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file or directory to set permission.
        permission - the file system permission to be set.
        Throws:
        HDFSConnectorException - if any issue occurs during the execution.

      • setOwner

        @Processor
public void setOwner(String path,
                      @Optional
                      String ownername,
                      @Optional
                      String groupname)
              throws HDFSConnectorException
        Set owner of a path (i.e., a file or a directory). The parameters username and groupname cannot both be null.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the file or directory to set owner.
        ownername - If it is null, the original username remains unchanged.
        groupname - If it is null, the original groupname remains unchanged.
        Throws:
        HDFSConnectorException - if any issue occurs during the execution.
